Literature Review: SMC complexes have been extensively studied in recent years due to their crucial role in chromosome biology and genome organization. These motor proteins are evolutionarily conserved and play a key role in holding sister chromatids together and folding genomes throughout the cell cycle by DNA loop extrusion. The detailed molecular mechanism for DNA loop extrusion by SMC complexes remains unresolved, and in vitro single-molecule studies have recently advanced our understanding of SMC proteins.
